verses.text: These are the generations of Aaron and Moses at the time when the Lord spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.
verses.comment: The phrase 'generations of' means the family records or genealogy.

verses.text: These are the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab the firstborn, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
These are the names of the sons of Aaron, the anointed priests, whom he consecrated to serve as priests.
verses.comment: The term 'consecrated' can also be translated as 'ordained', meaning to set apart for priestly service.

verses.text: But Nadab and Abihu died before the Lord when they offered unauthorized fire before the Lord in the Wilderness of Sinai, and they had no children. So Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests in the presence of Aaron their father.
verses.comment: 'Unauthorized fire' refers to worship contrary to God's command.

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
Bring the tribe of Levi near, and set them before Aaron the priest, so they may serve him.
They shall perform duties for him and for the whole congregation before the Tent of Meeting, doing the service of the tabernacle.
They shall also be in charge of all the furnishings of the Tent of Meeting and fulfill the duties for the Israelites by doing the service of the tabernacle.
You must give the Levites to Aaron and his sons; they are wholly given to him from among the people of Israel.
verses.comment: 'Wholly given' is literally 'they are given, given'—Hebrew uses repetition for emphasis.

verses.text: And you shall appoint Aaron and his sons, and they must guard their priesthood. But any outsider who comes near shall be put to death.
verses.comment: 'Outsider' means anyone not of Aaron’s priestly family.

verses.text: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
See, I have taken the Levites from among the Israelites in place of every firstborn who opens the womb among the Israelites. Therefore, the Levites shall be mine,
verses.comment: God chooses Levites to replace firstborn sons for his service.

verses.text: for all the firstborn are mine. On the day that I struck down all the firstborn in Egypt, I set apart for myself all the firstborn in Israel, both man and animal. They shall be mine: I am the Lord.
The Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, saying,
Count the sons of Levi by their fathers’ houses and by clans. You shall count every male a month old and upward.
verses.comment: Other tribes are counted from 20 years; Levites from 1 month.

verses.text: So Moses counted them according to the word of the Lord, as he was commanded.
These were the sons of Levi by name: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
These are the names of the sons of Gershon by their clans: Libni and Shimei.
The sons of Kohath by their clans: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
The sons of Merari by their clans: Mahli and Mushi. These are the clans of the Levites, by their fathers’ houses.
To Gershon belonged the clan of the Libnites and the clan of the Shimeites—these were the clans of the Gershonites.
The number of all the males from a month old and upward was 7,500.
verses.comment: The original uses Hebrew numerals; modernized for clarity.

verses.text: The clans of the Gershonites were to camp behind the tabernacle on the west side.
Eliasaph the son of Lael was chief of the fathers’ house of the Gershonites.
At the Tent of Meeting, the duty of the sons of Gershon involved the tabernacle and the tent, its covering, the screen for the entrance of the Tent of Meeting,
the curtains of the court, the screen for the entrance of the court surrounding the tabernacle and the altar, and the cords for all its service.
To Kohath belonged the clan of the Amramites, the clan of the Izharites, the clan of the Hebronites, and the clan of the Uzzielites—these were the clans of the Kohathites.
Counting every male from a month old and upward, there were 8,600, serving at the sanctuary.
The clans of the sons of Kohath were to camp on the south side of the tabernacle.
Elizaphan the son of Uzziel was chief of the fathers’ house of the clans of the Kohathites.
Their responsibility was the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, the vessels of the sanctuary with which they minister, the screen, and all its service.
The chief of the chiefs of the Levites was Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, who supervised those who kept guard over the sanctuary.
verses.comment: 'Chief of the chiefs' means the overall leader of the Levites.

verses.text: To Merari belonged the clan of the Mahlites and the clan of the Mushites—these were the clans of Merari.
Their count, by every male from a month old and upward, was 6,200.
Zuriel the son of Abihail was chief of the fathers’ house of the clans of Merari. They were to camp on the north side of the tabernacle.
The appointed duty of the sons of Merari involved the frames of the tabernacle, its bars, its pillars, its bases, all its accessories, all its service,
and the pillars of the surrounding court, their bases, pegs, and cords.

Those to camp before the tabernacle on the east, before the Tent of Meeting toward the sunrise, were Moses and Aaron and his sons, keeping guard over the sanctuary for Israel. Any outsider who approached was to be put to death.
All who were counted of the Levites, whom Moses and Aaron counted at the Lord’s command by their clans, all the males from a month old and upward, were 22,000.
The Lord said to Moses, “Count all the firstborn males of the people of Israel from a month old and upward, and take the number of their names.

And you shall take the Levites for me—I am the Lord—in place of all the firstborn among the Israelites, and the livestock of the Levites in place of all the firstborn among the livestock of the Israelites.”
So Moses counted all the firstborn among the Israelites, as the Lord commanded him.
All the firstborn males, according to the list of names from a month old and upward, as numbered, were 22,273.
The Lord spoke to Moses, saying,
“Take the Levites in place of all the firstborn among the Israelites, and the livestock of the Levites in place of their livestock. The Levites shall be mine: I am the Lord.
For the redemption price of the 273 of the firstborn of the Israelites, who exceed the number of the Levites,
verses.comment: 'Exceed the number'—there are more firstborn than Levites, so a ransom is required.

verses.text: you shall take five shekels each, for each individual; you shall take them according to the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel is twenty gerahs),
verses.comment: A shekel is roughly 10–13 grams of silver.

verses.text: and give the money, by which the excess number of them is redeemed, to Aaron and his sons.
So Moses took the redemption money from those who exceeded the number redeemed by the Levites.
From the firstborn of the Israelites he took the money, 1,365 shekels, according to the shekel of the sanctuary.
And Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and his sons, according to the word of the Lord, as the Lord commanded Moses.
